<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 222px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/fe/Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170314002945" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="220" height="283" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Patronus PM SilverStagPatronus MomentIllust.jpg" data-image-key="Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/fe/Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20170314002945" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/fe/Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170314002945" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/fe/Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20170314002945" decoding="async" width="220" height="283" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Patronus PM SilverStagPatronus MomentIllust.jpg" data-image-key="Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/fe/Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20170314002945" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Patronus_PM_SilverStagPatronus_MomentIllust.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry's corporeal stag <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Accio Quote!">"<i>Harry.... is becoming exceptionally good at <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>. So that's the one area in which, almost instinctively, he is particularly talented. Apart from <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a>.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> regarding Harry's magical talents<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Accio_Quote!" title="Accio Quote!">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Harry was seen and had proven himself to be an extremely powerful and talented wizard. His power was evident from the start: he demonstrated immediate command of a <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a>, was able to conjure a corporeal Patronus at an exceptionally young age (a mark of superior magical ability),<sup id="cite_ref-PM_89-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-89">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> and even survived numerous encounters with Lord Voldemort. He mastered a wand made of <a href="/wiki/Hawthorn" title="Hawthorn">hawthorn</a>, which one should only ever consider placing in the hands of a witch or wizard of proven talent.<sup id="cite_ref-PM-wands_106-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-wands-106">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup> Harry was also a very gifted <a href="/wiki/Flight" title="Flight">flyer</a> and Quidditch player, the youngest <a href="/wiki/Seeker" title="Seeker">Seeker</a> in a century. 
</p>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">Love</a></b>: Harry's greatest power of all was his ability to love. In spite of being raised by a family that treated him with anything but affection, Harry remarkably turned out capable of very strong love. For example, Harry's love for his friends caused him to sacrifice himself to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. This loving sacrifice conferred a certain amount of <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">protection</a> onto his allies, making it so that <a href="/wiki/Spell" title="Spell">spells</a> Voldemort tried to place on them quickly wore off.<sup id="cite_ref-DH36_107-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH36-107">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup> Harry's ability to love has also protected and helped him on several occasions. Those occasions are: when he produced a Patronus that could drive hundreds of <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> away,<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup> repelled Voldemort when he possessed him,<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP36_100-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP36-100">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup> and the times he was able to close the connection between himself and Voldemort.<sup id="cite_ref-DH24_109-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH24-109">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> His love was strongest when directed at <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, who was the driving force that kept him going until Voldemort was defeated. Harry also felt strong love toward his three children, such as when he deliberately placed himself between his son <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a>. Harry even felt compassion and pity for his enemies, offering Voldemort a chance to feel remorse for his actions.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Accio Quote!">"<i>Harry — he has an extraordinary instinct for the right thing to do. He's just got the right instinct, and that's what would make him, in due course, a phenomenal Auror.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> regarding Harry's time as an Auror<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Accio_Quote!" title="Accio Quote!">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Auror_training" title="Auror training">Auror skills</a></b>: Harry was extremely young for an Auror, which spoke highly of his magical abilities. He became Head of the <a href="/wiki/Auror_Office" title="Auror Office">Auror Office</a> at the age of 26, presumably the youngest Head appointed. During his time in the department, he gained skills in various areas of magic such as: <a href="/wiki/Concealment_and_Disguise" title="Concealment and Disguise">Concealment and Disguise</a>, <a href="/wiki/Stealth_and_Tracking" title="Stealth and Tracking">Stealth and Tracking</a>, and poisons and antidotes. Being a fully qualified Auror meant three additional years of study, all of these areas of magic were essential. He also had high skill in <a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a>, as Aurors had to frequently transfigure and <a href="/wiki/Untransfiguration" title="Untransfiguration">untransfigure</a> things in their line of work.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> Harry also possessed a great instinct for the right thing to do, especially when faced with stressful and difficult situations. This instinct contributed to him becoming a fantastic Auror. Harry has also been stated as being a consummate expert in his line of work.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Harry, you're the best in the year at Defence Against the Dark Arts.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> emphasising Harry's talent in defensive magic<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 247px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b4/Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140307222201" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="245" height="150" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Relashio being used against Grindylows.gif" data-image-key="Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b4/Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/245?cb=20140307222201" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b4/Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140307222201" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b4/Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/245?cb=20140307222201" decoding="async" width="245" height="150" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Relashio being used against Grindylows.gif" data-image-key="Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b4/Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/245?cb=20140307222201" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Relashio_being_used_against_Grindylows.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry defends himself against <a href="/wiki/Grindylow" title="Grindylow">Grindylows</a> in 1995</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a></b>: Harry was extremely adept at Defence Against the Dark Arts, having mastered all manners of spells. Some of the spells include: <a href="/wiki/Stunning_Spell" title="Stunning Spell">Stunning Spell</a>, <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a>, <a href="/wiki/Impediment_Jinx" title="Impediment Jinx">Impediment Jinx</a>, <a href="/wiki/Full_Body-Bind_Curse" title="Full Body-Bind Curse">Full Body-Bind Curse</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Reductor_Curse" title="Reductor Curse">Reductor Curse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP34_112-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP34-112">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup> In fact, his Stunning Spell was so strong that opponents would get knocked out if they were hit directly. He was also skilled at defending himself against Dark creatures such as: <a href="/wiki/Grindylow" title="Grindylow">Grindylows</a>, <a href="/wiki/Red_Cap" title="Red Cap">Red Caps</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hinkypunk" title="Hinkypunk">Hinkypunks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggarts</a>, <a href="/wiki/Erkling" title="Erkling">Erklings</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a>. In his third year, he was the only student who flawlessly made it through the end-of-the-year exam (an obstacle course containing some of the said creatures.<sup id="cite_ref-POA16_113-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA16-113">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup>) In his fifth year, <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Professor McGonagall</a> stated that <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Professor Lupin</a> said he showed a "pronounced aptitude" for the subject and that he had "<i>achieved high marks on all his Defence Against the Dark Arts tests</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP29_114-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP29-114">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup> In fact, Harry had beaten Hermione in two of the three Defence Against the Dark Arts exams they had taken together. The only exam she beat him in was their first year exam and Hermione later reflected that it did not count, as Quirrell "wasn't a particularly good teacher".<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP16_115-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP16-115">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup> Harry improved his skills in this subject significantly during his fourth year, by learning a lot of new spells in order to face the Triwizard Tournament. During his O.W.L. examination, Professor <a href="/wiki/Tofty" title="Tofty">Tofty</a> (Wizarding Examinations Authority) expressed pleasure at Harry's performance of Defence Against the Dark Arts, calling it "excellent".<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP31_116-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP31-116">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup> This statement was later proven true when he achieved an '<a href="/wiki/Outstanding" title="Outstanding">Outstanding</a>'<sup id="cite_ref-HBP5_81-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP5-81">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> Defence Against the Dark Arts <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">O.W.L.</a> (something that not even Hermione achieved), a testament of his extraordinary talent in defensive magic. In 1996, Ron stated that it came as no surprise that Harry was top of the class at Defence Against the Dark Arts.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP5_81-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP5-81">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> Indeed, Harry was so good at DADA that when the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> prevented the subject from being taught effectively in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, he set up his own DADA club and successfully taught members how to defend themselves against the Dark Arts. He immediately became an <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> after the Second Wizarding War, which also required considerable skill in both defensive and offensive magic. Harry also developed a high level of resistance towards the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a>, demonstrated when it was cast upon him by <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a> (disguised as <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>) in 1994 and by <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> himself in 1995.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF34_97-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF34-97">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>...there's no point pretending that you're not good at Defence Against the Dark Arts, because you are. You were the only person last year who could throw off the Imperius Curse completely, you can produce a <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a>, you can do all sorts of stuff that full-grown wizards can't, Viktor always said... Harry knew how to do stuff even he didn't, and he was in the final year at Durmstrang.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;Hermione Granger regarding Harry's abilities in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 252px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140405022531" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="250" height="106" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250.gif" data-image-key="Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20140405022531" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140405022531" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20140405022531" decoding="async" width="250" height="106" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250.gif" data-image-key="Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20140405022531" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry duelling Voldemort in <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton" title="Little Hangleton">Little Hangleton</a> graveyard</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Duelling" title="Duelling">Duelling</a></b>: Despite his young age, Harry was an accomplished and skilful duellist. He was able to single-handedly defeat some of the most formidable <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> and even survive numerous encounters with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> himself. He eventually defeated Voldemort by becoming the master of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>. In many battles of the Second Wizarding War, he was able to incapacitate much more experienced Death Eaters. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>; he, <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> were the only fighters on the Order's side to emerge from the battle physically unscathed. In that time, he had held off <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Antonin_Dolohov" title="Antonin Dolohov">Antonin Dolohov</a> twice and was able to hold his own against the extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_117-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-117">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup> In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a> Harry defeated <a href="/wiki/Corban_Yaxley" title="Corban Yaxley">Yaxley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>, and one of the two Carrows.<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> He fought off several Death Eaters in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>. During the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a> he overpowered Lucius Malfoy, <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, and Fenrir Greyback and avoided direct conflict damage all throughout the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup> Harry was known to be very quick off the draw and had an aggressive duelling style, even incorporating Unforgivable Curses. He was also known to taunt his opponents and would get them to talk at length, angering them and throwing them mentally off-balance. He did this in order to buy himself time to strategise or to lull them into lowering their guard. Harry was especially skilled in the <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a> and used it so much that it was seen as his "signature spell" by many Death Eaters. His most notable uses of the Disarming Charm were when he formed <a href="/wiki/Reverse_Spell" title="Reverse Spell">Priori Incantatem</a> with Voldemort and when he finally killed the Dark Lord. At the remarkably young age of seventeen, Harry became an Auror and was promoted to Head of the Auror Office at the age of 26.<sup id="cite_ref-WOTM_56-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WOTM-56">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup> He was able to quite easily defeat without any injuries to himself the skilled <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Nott" title="Theodore Nott">Theodore Nott</a> in a duel during a raid on Nott's home and while holding back, could fight Draco, who had similarly improved his duelling skills, to a standstill. Harry was even able to hold his own against <a href="/wiki/Delphini" title="Delphini">Delphini</a>, they "<i>fired bolts mercilessly at each other</i>" during their church duel, long enough for his friends to come to his aid, after which they swiftly defeated Delphini.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">&#91;121&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i> </i>Imperio<i>" Harry said again; his voice echoed through the stone passage as he felt the familiar sense of heady control that flowed from brain to wand.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;Harry casting an <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curse</a> on <a href="/wiki/Bogrod" title="Bogrod">Bogrod</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark Arts</a></b>: Harry was one of the few non-<a href="/wiki/Dark_Wizard" title="Dark Wizard">Dark Wizards</a> who was highly proficient in the Dark Arts at all levels. On top of being able to cast simple <a href="/wiki/Dark_charm" title="Dark charm">dark charms</a> like the <a href="/wiki/Leg-Locker_Curse" title="Leg-Locker Curse">Leg-Locker Curse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Full_Body-Bind_Curse" title="Full Body-Bind Curse">Full Body-Bind Curse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Reductor_Curse" title="Reductor Curse">Reductor Curse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pimple_Jinx" title="Pimple Jinx">Pimple Jinx</a>, <a href="/wiki/Knockback_Jinx" title="Knockback Jinx">Knockback Jinx</a>, <a href="/wiki/Revulsion_Jinx" title="Revulsion Jinx">Revulsion Jinx</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Melofors_Jinx" title="Melofors Jinx">Melofors Jinx</a>, he could cast more powerful dark spells such as the <a href="/wiki/Blasting_Curse" title="Blasting Curse">Blasting Curse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH4_122-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH4-122">&#91;122&#93;</a></sup> He was also able to flawlessly cast the <a href="/wiki/Jinx" title="Jinx">jinxes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hex" title="Hex">hexes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Curse" title="Curse">curses</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Half-Blood_Prince%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" class="mw-redirect" title="Half-Blood Prince&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making">Half-Blood Prince's copy of <i>Advanced Potion-Making</i></a>, such as the <a href="/wiki/Toenail-growing_hex" title="Toenail-growing hex">Toenail-growing hex</a> and the extremely dangerous curse <a href="/wiki/Sectumsempra" title="Sectumsempra">Sectumsempra</a>, which he cast at Draco Malfoy in 1997, severely slashing and wounding him.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_102-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-102">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> Harry even used two of the three <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curses</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a> on <a href="/wiki/Travers" title="Travers">Travers</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Goblin" title="Goblin">Goblin</a> called <a href="/wiki/Bogrod" title="Bogrod">Bogrod</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Break-in_of_Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank_(1998)" title="Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank (1998)">1998 Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-DH26_123-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH26-123">&#91;123&#93;</a></sup> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> on several occasions. However, his first successful attempt was in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a> against <a href="/wiki/Amycus_Carrow" title="Amycus Carrow">Amycus Carrow</a>, but it did not result in the prolonged, excruciating pain that the curse was famous for — instead, Carrow screamed and was incapacitated.<sup id="cite_ref-DH30_124-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH30-124">&#91;124&#93;</a></sup> He never used the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> for obviously moral reasons, even in his final battle with Voldemort.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone">"<i>You're the youngest Seeker in a century.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> discussing Harry's flying talent<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 252px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png/revision/latest?cb=20161118061421" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="250" height="166" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="HBP Harry Playing Quidditch™.png" data-image-key="HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch™.png" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161118061421" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png/revision/latest?cb=20161118061421" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161118061421" decoding="async" width="250" height="166" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="HBP Harry Playing Quidditch™.png" data-image-key="HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch™.png" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161118061421" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:HBP_Harry_Playing_Quidditch%E2%84%A2.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry on his broom</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Flight" title="Flight">Flying</a></b>: Harry had inherited his <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">father</a>'s talent for flying and for <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a>. Harry showed immediate command of a <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a> in his first year, which made him a naturally good <a href="/wiki/Seeker" title="Seeker">Seeker</a>. This was the first magical skill for which he discovered an aptitude, as he found in 1991. In fact, at the mere age of eleven, Harry became the youngest Seeker in a century.<sup id="cite_ref-PS9_125-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS9-125">&#91;125&#93;</a></sup> As a Seeker, Harry was capable of surpassing even far more experienced Seekers, near-always winning the Quidditch matches for Gryffindor, and was considered to be even better than <a href="/wiki/Charles_Weasley" title="Charles Weasley">Charlie Weasley</a>, with the only time he ever lost to <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a> being due to the presence of <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a>. <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> noted that Harry's Quidditch skills were equal to his father's own. His extraordinary flying skills also aided him when pursuing the <a href="/wiki/Winged_Keys" title="Winged Keys">Winged Keys</a> enchanted by <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Professor Flitwick</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone_Chambers" class="mw-redirect" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone Chambers">Philosopher's Stone Chambers</a>, with him being the primary leader of the trio's chase of the Keys and the one who noticed and captured the Key needed to unlock the door. It also helped him in the Triwizard Tournament (where he had to steal a golden egg from a <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Horntail" title="Hungarian Horntail">Hungarian Horntail</a>), managing to successfully irritate the dragon into chasing him by dodging all her flame attacks and then outrace her into the egg, a display that highly impressed all of the witnesses and earned him the first place among the Triwizard Champions. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> he also managed to escape a <a href="/wiki/Fiendfyre" title="Fiendfyre">Fiendfyre</a> inferno in the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>, via broomstick.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parseltongue</a></b>: Because he carried <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">a piece of Voldemort's soul</a> within himself, Harry was able to speak and understand Parseltongue from <a href="/wiki/1981" title="1981">1981</a> to <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>. After that soul fragment was destroyed, Harry seemingly lost this ability. However, in 2020, Harry had somehow regained the ability to speak Parseltongue again, although it was possible he never lost to begin with or that the ability simply became temporarily suppressed after the Horcrux was destroyed.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Mind-reading" title="Mind-reading">Insight into Voldemort's mind</a></b>: Also due to the piece of Voldemort's soul, Harry was able to look into Voldemort's mind and see through his senses from time to time. He sometimes used this ability to monitor what <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> was doing. However, it was a dangerous ability to have as well; Voldemort once used it, along with <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimency</a>, to plant a false vision in Harry's mind of <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> being tortured, which he used to lure Harry to the <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Mysteries" title="Department of Mysteries">Department of Mysteries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP23_126-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP23-126">&#91;126&#93;</a></sup> Additionally, because of their connection, Harry felt a burning pain in his scar whenever he and Voldemort were in close proximity or whenever Voldemort felt strong negative emotions. Harry lost this ability as well when the soul fragment within him was destroyed. Harry also possessed a non-magical insight into Voldemort's mind from the information Dumbledore shared with him during their lessons. This insight allowed Harry to figure out that a <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a> was stored at <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a> after which Ron and Hermoine noted Harry's understanding of Voldemort causing to Harry admit that he did understand parts of Voldemort.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Master_of_Death" title="Master of Death">Master of Death</a></b>: Harry mastered all three Deathly Hallows and accepted his own death.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_47-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-47">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> First, he inherited the <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a> from his father, James. Then, he inherited the <a href="/wiki/Resurrection_Stone" title="Resurrection Stone">Resurrection Stone</a> from Dumbledore, which was inside a snitch. Finally, he won the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> from Draco Malfoy during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>. All three were directly or indirectly employed by Harry in the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest" title="Forbidden Forest">Forbidden Forest</a>: he was wearing the Cloak, using the Stone, and was preparing to be killed by the Wand, which he had already won.<sup id="cite_ref-DH34_127-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH34-127">&#91;127&#93;</a></sup> The only Hallow he choose to keep was the cloak as it was a priceless family heirloom; the stone was lost in the forest and the wand returned to Dumbledore's tomb.<sup id="cite_ref-DH36_107-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH36-107">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>He had even exceeded expectations at Potions!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;Harry reviewing his O.W.L. result<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>

<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Potion" title="Potion">Potions</a></b>: Although Harry's strong dislike for Snape made Potions the subject he was worst at, it was later on shown that Harry had no problem with potions with Slughorn as his teacher,<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP29_114-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP29-114">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-OOTP31_116-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP31-116">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup> showing that he had indeed inherited Lily's talent in potions to some extent. This was also shown when Snape did not pester him about his brewing a reasonably adequate <a href="/wiki/Strengthening_Solution" title="Strengthening Solution">Strengthening Solution</a> and Harry even concocted an <a href="/wiki/Invigoration_Draught" title="Invigoration Draught">Invigoration Draught</a> good enough that he would have earned an Exceeds Expectations had Hermione not vanished it. Indeed, he achieved an '<a href="/wiki/Exceeds_Expectations" title="Exceeds Expectations">Exceeds Expectations</a>'<sup id="cite_ref-HBP5_81-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP5-81">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> on his O.W.L. exam — proof of his proficiency in the subject and was one of only twelve students able to reach the required level to take <a href="/wiki/Nastily_Exhausting_Wizarding_Test" title="Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test">N.E.W.T.</a> potions, although he wouldn't have if Snape had kept teaching Potions.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP9_12-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP9-12">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> His great success during his sixth year was only after he came into possession of the <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Severus Snape&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making">Half-Blood Prince's copy of <i>Advanced Potion-Making</i></a> which contained revised instructions from the Half-Blood Prince (<a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>). Using that textbook, Harry gained the position of best in class, surpassing even Hermione's efforts. However, after he had to hide the Prince's book, Harry was still able to do a decent enough job at potion-making that <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Slughorn</a>'s suspicions were not raised. It was probable that he improved his Potions ability during his Auror career, at least becoming proficient enough in Poisons and Antidotes as required.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I was pleased with your Transfiguration mark, Potter, very pleased.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Professor McGonagall</a> complimenting Harry's O.W.L. result<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a></b>: Harry achieved an 'Exceeds Expectations'<sup id="cite_ref-HBP5_81-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP5-81">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> on his O.W.L. exam, showing proficiency in the subject and advanced to <a href="/wiki/Nastily_Exhausting_Wizarding_Test" title="Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test">N.E.W.T.</a>-level. He was able to perform <a href="/wiki/Conjuration" title="Conjuration">Conjuration</a>, an advanced type of Transfiguration. Harry demonstrated this at various points by conjuring <a href="/wiki/Incarcerous_Spell" title="Incarcerous Spell">ropes</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-HBP26_128-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP26-128">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">&#91;129&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Water-Making_Spell" title="Water-Making Spell">water</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-HBP26_128-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP26-128">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Fire-Making_Spell" title="Fire-Making Spell">fire</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">&#91;130&#93;</a></sup> He could also <a href="/wiki/Vanishing_Spell" title="Vanishing Spell">vanish</a> objects, which is one of the most complicated spells taught at <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">Ordinary Wizarding Level</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, Harry vanished the whole of an <a href="/wiki/Iguana" title="Iguana">iguana</a><sup id="cite_ref-OOTP31_116-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP31-116">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup> and in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a> a snake that crossed his path. He was also skilled in <a href="/wiki/Transforming_Spells" title="Transforming Spells">Transforming Spells</a>; for example he could cast the <a href="/wiki/Avifors_Spell" title="Avifors Spell">Avifors Spell</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COS.7CG_131-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS.7CG-131">&#91;131&#93;</a></sup> Harry was also skilled enough to perform <a href="/wiki/Human_Transfiguration" title="Human Transfiguration">Human Transfiguration</a>, which is noted to be "immensely difficult". He accomplished this during a 1996 Transfiguration lesson, were he succeeded in turning his eyebrow bright yellow.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP15_14-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP15-14">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup> Minerva McGonagall herself complimented him on his talents in transfiguration.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP9_12-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP9-12">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source:&#160;Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Impressive. A true Patronus at that age... very impressive indeed.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Amelia_Bones" title="Amelia Bones">Amelia Bones</a> impressed by Harry's ability to conjure a corporeal Patronus<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
