<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 182px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Dhharryroomhighreso.png/revision/latest?cb=20181009213828" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="180" height="360" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dhharryroomhighreso.png" data-image-key="Dhharryroomhighreso.png" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Dhharryroomhighreso.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20181009213828" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Dhharryroomhighreso.png/revision/latest?cb=20181009213828" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Dhharryroomhighreso.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20181009213828" decoding="async" width="180" height="360" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dhharryroomhighreso.png" data-image-key="Dhharryroomhighreso.png" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Dhharryroomhighreso.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20181009213828" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dhharryroomhighreso.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Daniel Radcliffe as Harry Potter</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>Harry is portrayed by <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">British</a> actor <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_(film_series)" title="Harry Potter (film series)">film adaptations</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">Chamber of Secrets</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">Prisoner of Azkaban</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">Goblet of Fire</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">Order of the Phoenix</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">Half-Blood Prince</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Part 2</a></i> and so is one of the 14 characters to appear in all 8 film adaptations. By the time <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i> was released, Radcliffe had played the role for ten years consecutively.
<ul><li>The first actor to be cast as Harry was actually American actor <a href="http://www.imdb.com/find?q=nm0014582" class="extiw" title="imdb:nm0014582">Liam Aiken</a>, but he lost the part the next day, allegedly because he wasn't British.</li></ul></li>
<li>Harry is portrayed by British actor <a href="/wiki/Jamie_Parker" title="Jamie Parker">Jamie Parker</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Cursed_Child_(play)#Original_West_End_production" title="Harry Potter and the Cursed Child (play)">original West End production</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Cursed_Child" title="Harry Potter and the Cursed Child">Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-cast1_162-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cast1-162">&#91;162&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Both Daniel Radcliffe (Harry) and Emma Watson (<a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>) speak in Modernised Received Pronunciation, an accent associated with prestige and wealth, but in the story, most characters that speak in RP are <a href="/wiki/Pure-blood" title="Pure-blood">pure-bloods</a>.</li>
<li>Interestingly, Harry and Ginny share the same star sign: Leo, also the sign of their house, Gryffindor. <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> and <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a>, too, share the same star sign.</li>
<li>Harry's first friends were Rubeus Hagrid and Ronald Weasley. Interestingly, both had names that start with the letter "R".</li>
<li>Several undisclosed theories suggest that, as per the prophecy, Voldemort was the only one capable of killing Harry. Meaning that, with Voldemort dead, Harry cannot be killed, though he can presumably still die of natural causes. Still, in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Cursed_Child" title="Harry Potter and the Cursed Child">Harry Potter and the Cursed Child</a></i>, Harry was killed by <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> in an alternate universe.</li>
<li>Several times throughout Cursed Child, Harry has been called "savior of the wizarding world", it is unknown whether this is a given title or an alias that has been given to Harry in his older age. Although, this places Harry higher in respect than Dumbledore, in his defeat of an internationally wanted wizard.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a> never provided voice-acting for any of the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_video_games" title="Harry Potter video games"><i>Harry Potter</i> video games</a>. Harry is instead voiced by <a href="/wiki/Joe_Sowerbutts" title="Joe Sowerbutts">Joe Sowerbutts</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (video game)"><i>Philosopher's Stone</i> video game</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tom_Attenborough" title="Tom Attenborough">Tom Attenborough</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (video game)"><i>Chamber of Secrets</i> video game</a>, both <a href="/wiki/Tom_Attenborough" title="Tom Attenborough">Tom Attenborough</a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Robinson" title="Harry Robinson">Harry Robinson</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (video game)"><i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> video game</a>, <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Larner" title="Daniel Larner">Daniel Larner</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (video game)"><i>Goblet of Fire</i> video game</a>, both <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Larner" title="Daniel Larner">Daniel Larner</a> and <a href="/wiki/Adam_Sopp" title="Adam Sopp">Adam Sopp</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (video game)"><i>Order of the Phoenix</i> video game</a>, and again by <a href="/wiki/Adam_Sopp" title="Adam Sopp">Adam Sopp</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (video game)"><i>Deathly Hallows: Part 1</i></a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (video game)"><i>Deathly Hallows: Part 2</i> video games</a>.</li>
<li>In the whole <i>Harry Potter</i> series, Harry has only called Draco Malfoy by just his first name two times.
<ul><li>The first time was when they were in detention in the Forbidden Forest in their first year.</li>
<li>The second and last time he called Draco Malfoy by his first name was during the final duel with Voldemort in the Great Hall, when Harry talked about the mastery of the Elder wand. He said that Voldemort wasn't the master of the Elder Wand, Draco was.</li></ul></li>
<li>Harry is right-handed. He tells this to Mr Ollivander in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</a></i>. He is also seen writing with this hand throughout the film series.</li>
<li>Despite Harry's birthday being on July 31st in the books, it seems that in the first film it was moved to August 31st, because Hagrid first met Harry in the <a href="/wiki/Hut-on-the-Rock" title="Hut-on-the-Rock">shack</a> on the day of Harry's birthday, then he took Harry to Diagon Alley and then to King's Cross the next day, where Harry took the Hogwarts Express.</li>
<li>He often describes various parts of his anatomy as feeling like <a href="/wiki/Lead" title="Lead">lead</a>.</li>
<li>In the films, Harry is shown to wear the colour blue in nearly all his clothing. It could possibly connect with the symbolic meanings of the colour to be that of; trust, wisdom, loyalty, confidence, intelligence, faith, truth and heaven. These particular attributes are significantly linked to Harry's personality throughout the series.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Josh_Herdman" title="Josh Herdman">Josh Herdman</a> plays Harry when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Goyle" title="Gregory Goyle">Gregory Goyle</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">Chamber of Secrets</a>,</i> as does <a href="/wiki/David_O%27Hara" title="David O&#39;Hara">David O'Hara</a> when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Albert_Runcorn" title="Albert Runcorn">Albert Runcorn</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i>. The <a href="/wiki/Saunders_triplets" title="Saunders triplets">Saunders triplets</a> play Harry as an infant in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">Philosopher's Stone</a></i> and <a href="/wiki/Toby_Papworth" title="Toby Papworth">Toby Papworth</a> plays Harry as an infant in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i>.</li>
<li>In a deleted scene of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i>, when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Albert_Runcorn" title="Albert Runcorn">Albert Runcorn</a>, Harry calls <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur Weasley</a> by his first name. This is the only time Harry does this.</li>
<li>Daniel Radcliffe and Harry were both born in July — Harry on the 31st and Daniel on the 23rd.</li>
<li>Harry has green eyes, but in the films he has blue eyes. This is due to the fact that Daniel Radcliffe was allergic to the contact lenses. Radcliffe also has brown hair, as opposed to Harry's black hair, and also has a strong physical body, rather than the slim frame Harry is described as having. However Harry is only described as having an uncommonly 'slim' frame in the earlier instalments, so it is possible that he bulked out a little into a lean frame as he matured.</li>
<li>Harry's birthday of 31 July is also the birthday of <i>Harry Potter</i> author, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>, and actor <a href="/wiki/Richard_Griffiths" title="Richard Griffiths">Richard Griffiths</a> who played Harry's Uncle <a href="/wiki/Vernon_Dursley" title="Vernon Dursley">Vernon Dursley</a> in the Harry Potter films.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a>, Harry saw his family, a lot of people with untidy black hair, his own noses, mouths and knees. However, he also saw some people with almond-shaped green eyes, which could indicate that he saw his <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> family as well, even though he did not see the <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">Dursley family</a>.</li></ul>
<figure class="thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 157px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190128215030" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="155" height="205" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="DH chapter 18 BW.jpg" data-image-key="DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/155?cb=20190128215030" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190128215030" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/155?cb=20190128215030" decoding="async" width="155" height="205" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="DH chapter 18 BW.jpg" data-image-key="DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/155?cb=20190128215030" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:DH_chapter_18_BW.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry as portrayed in Deathly Hallows book art</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a></i>, Harry is seen practising <a href="/wiki/Lumos_Maxima" title="Lumos Maxima">Lumos Maxima</a> under the covers in his bedroom, but Harry does not get a letter from the <a href="/wiki/Improper_Use_of_Magic_Office" title="Improper Use of Magic Office">Improper Use of Magic Office</a> even though he is under-age, however, judging by the book he is reading, his reason for doing so is most likely for homework. In the book he is simply using a torch while writing his homework for <a href="/wiki/History_of_Magic" title="History of Magic">History of Magic</a>.</li>
<li>While Harry repeatedly states <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> is the best student in his year in all classes, he has beaten her in two of the three Defence Against the Dark Arts exams they had together, with Hermione only beating him in their first year exam. In addition, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> has said that Harry could have beaten Hermione in a magical duel halfway through <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">Prisoner of Azkaban</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup> Part of this can be put down to <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Professor Lupin</a>'s way of teaching, which preferred practical lessons over theory, as it seemed to help bring out Harry's own talent at the subject. It is probably more accurate to say that Hermione is the best student in every subject but DADA, in which Harry is strongest; hence, in Harry's mind she is the best student overall.</li>
<li>Harry's niece and nephew, <a href="/wiki/Rose_Granger-Weasley" title="Rose Granger-Weasley">Rose</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hugo_Granger-Weasley" title="Hugo Granger-Weasley">Hugo</a>, have some of the same heritage of Harry. A <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> mother, <a href="/wiki/Lily_J._Potter" title="Lily J. Potter">Lily</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>, and a <a href="/wiki/Pure-blood" title="Pure-blood">pure-blood</a> father, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">James</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a>. This makes Rose, Hugo and Harry all half-bloods.</li>
<li>Throughout the films, Harry's hair grows longer and longer (the longest point was in <i>Goblet of Fire</i>) until it was cut for <i>Order of the Phoenix</i>. It has since grown to about the same length as it was for <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i>.</li>
<li>In the films, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_scars" title="Harry Potter&#39;s scars">Harry's scar</a> is off-centre on his forehead; this was apparently done at <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>'s request: because of the books' artwork, many fans believe the scar is in the centre of his head. But it is never explicitly mentioned where the scar is located. On all the U.S. book covers (illustrations), the scar on Harry's forehead is located in the centre. The same is definitely true of the last two U.K. instalments; however, on early U.K. book covers, Harry's scar tends to appear slightly off-centre. It is somewhat hard to tell on most of these covers, as Harry's face is only visible in profile. However, on the U.K. cover of Chamber of Secrets, Harry's scar is decidedly off-centre. It is perhaps of this book that Rowling was thinking.</li>
<li>The <a href="/wiki/Marauders" title="Marauders">Marauders</a> believed they discovered more secret places than anyone else in the history of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. This is not necessarily true, as unlike Harry and <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>, they did not discover the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> or the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>. However, as they discovered an untold number of secret passages and hidden rooms, they did discover more numerous secrets than Riddle or Harry, just not the same ones.</li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry,_A_History:_The_True_Story_of_a_Boy_Wizard,_His_Fans,_and_Life_Inside_the_Harry_Potter_Phenomenon" title="Harry, A History: The True Story of a Boy Wizard, His Fans, and Life Inside the Harry Potter Phenomenon">Harry, A History</a></i>, Rowling discussed how <a href="/wiki/Steve_Kloves" title="Steve Kloves">Steve Kloves</a> suspected that something might happen between Harry and Hermione in <i>Deathly Hallows</i>. She replied: "I had always planned that Harry's true soul mate, which I stand by, is Ginny, and that Ron and Hermione have this combative but mutual attraction. They will always bicker, there will always be rough edges there, but they are pulled together, each has something the other needs. [Kloves] felt a certain pull between them at that point. And I think he's right. There are moments when Harry and Hermione touch, which are charged moments. One when she touches his hair as he sits on the hilltop reading about Dumbledore and Grindelwald, and two the moment when they walk out of the graveyard with their arms around each other. Now the fact is that Hermione shares moments with Harry that Ron will never be able to participate in. He walked out. She shared something very intense with Harry. So I think it could have gone that way".<sup id="cite_ref-HAH_164-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HAH-164">&#91;164&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>In a interview Rowling says when Harry faced Voldemort in the forest and didn't defend himself that she never saw like a scientific equation and that Harry wasn't guaranteed to survive,  there has to be space, to make Harry truly heroic, for free will. It has to be his choice. The whole thing's his choice. He chooses to sacrifice himself just as Lily chose to sacrifice herself. He chooses to pull himself back to life, and that's his own will and courage. So ultimately, those things, all of them were more important than the magic.<sup id="cite_ref-Pottercast_87-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pottercast-87">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>The only person Harry ever considered killing by use of curse was <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> and possibly <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, ironically to avenge Sirius. It is, however, unclear if Harry knew how to cast the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Avada Kedavra</a> curse since he was not taught the <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curses</a> until his fourth year. Furthermore, when Harry found out that <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> was the one who had betrayed his parents to Voldemort, he did not want Sirius and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> to kill Pettigrew in revenge. Even during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, in which Harry defeated <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, Harry did not do so by use of any curse intended to do harm to his opponent, but rather he used his "trademark", <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Expelliarmus</a>. Harry finished Voldemort by reflecting a curse Harry would never use on another, even his mortal enemy. This suggests the <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>, which is "the power the Dark Lord knows not..." makes it difficult for Harry to kill. Even during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, Harry illustrated his unwillingness to kill <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. During that battle the Death Eaters were masked at the time, he could not know who was a willing follower and who was a controlled drone. However in the example with Voldemort, Harry knew Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> would backfire, so rather than use the same curse which would make him look somewhat bad, he instead decided to use the <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a> to gain possession of the wand.</li>
<li>Harry usually has the last line in every <i>Harry Potter</i> film. Though it could be debatable on whether he has the last line of the second film since the closed captions say that Dean said, "Yes!", so he may have had the last line.
<ul><li><i>"I'm not going home...not really.."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">PS/SS</a>)</li>
<li><i>"There's no <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> without you, <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a>."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">CS</a>)</li>
<li><i>"<a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Lumos</a>. <a href="/wiki/Marauder%27s_Map" title="Marauder&#39;s Map">I solemnly swear that I am up to no good</a>"/"<a href="/wiki/Wand-Extinguishing_Charm" title="Wand-Extinguishing Charm">Nox</a>.""</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">POA</a>)</li>
<li><i>"Yeah. Every week."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">GOF</a>)</li>
<li><i>"<a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">Something worth fighting for</a>."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">OOTP</a>)</li>
<li><i>"I never realised how beautiful <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">this place</a> was."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">HBP</a>)</li>
<li><i>"I want to bury him [ <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> ]... without magic."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">DHPt1</a>)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i> is the only film in which Harry does not speak the final line. It is spoken by his son <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus</a>: <i>"Ready."</i> However, it is also obvious that it's mostly Harry's other son <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_II" title="James Potter II">James</a> who says the last line in this film to Albus just before he (Albus) sits down next to his brother: <i>"Come on."</i></li></ul></li>
<li>Harry also has the last line in many of the books, and if not, he makes the last gesture.
<ul><li><i>"I'm going to have a lot of fun with <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley</a> this summer." </i><a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone">(PS)</a></li>
<li><i>"All those times I could've died and I didn't</i> <i>manage it? <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">They</a>'ll be furious!" </i><a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">(CS)</a></li>
<li><i>"He likes to keep in touch with me, ...keep up with my news...check I'm happy." </i><a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">(POA)</a></li>
<li><i>"Harry-thanks." Harry winked at them. (Spoken by <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a>)</i> <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">(GOF)</a></li>
<li><i>"Really soon Harry, we promise." Harry nodded. (Spoken by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>)</i> <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">(OOTP)</a></li>
<li><i>"Yeah we shouldn't miss that [ <a href="/wiki/Wedding_of_Bill_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour" class="mw-redirect" title="Wedding of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour">Bill and Fleur's Wedding</a> ]."</i> <a href="/wiki/Half-Blood_Prince" class="mw-redirect" title="Half-Blood Prince">(HBP)</a></li>
<li><i>"I know <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">he</a> will."</i> <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">(DH)</a></li></ul></li>
<li>Harry was <a href="/wiki/Wizard_of_the_Month" title="Wizard of the Month">Wizard of the Month</a> on <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>'s website for the month of October 2007.</li>
<li>Harry is the inspiration for the <a href="/wiki/Wizard_rock" title="Wizard rock">Wizard rock</a> band, <a href="/wiki/Harry_and_the_Potters" title="Harry and the Potters">Harry and the Potters</a>.</li>
<li>The makers of the film <i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-Men:_First_Class" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:X-Men: First Class">X-Men: First Class</a></i> used Harry Potter as their role model.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">&#91;165&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Harry Potter's former romantic relationship with <a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a> is well-known for being his first crush, first kiss and first girlfriend in the Harry Potter series.</li></ul>
<figure class="thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 182px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190426143930" class="image"><img alt="" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" width="180" height="245" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="GOF promo front Harry Potter.jpg" data-image-key="GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190426143930" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190426143930" class="image"><img alt="" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190426143930" decoding="async" width="180" height="245" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOF promo front Harry Potter.jpg" data-image-key="GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20190426143930" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:GOF_promo_front_Harry_Potter.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter in his fourth year</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>Harry Potter and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>'s romantic relationship is told in a different way in the films series from the novel versions of <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> and <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i>:
<ul><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">novel version of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a>,  Harry shares his first kiss with Ginny in front of <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> students in the <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor_Tower" title="Gryffindor Tower">Gryffindor Common Room</a> after the <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor_Quidditch_team" title="Gryffindor Quidditch team">Gryffindor Quidditch team</a> won the Quidditch Cup. He also breaks it off with her at Dumbledore's funeral.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a>, In the boy's dorms, Harry and Ron talk about Ginny snogging <a href="/wiki/Dean_Thomas" title="Dean Thomas">Dean Thomas</a>. Harry tells Ron that Ginny is "smart, funny, attractive". Ron doesn't understand that Harry has got feelings for Ginny, and Harry tries to hide his feelings for Ginny from Ron so that he doesn't ruin their friendship. Harry and Ginny go to the Room of Requirement together to hide Harry's copy of the Advanced Potion-Making book, which previously belong to the <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Half-Blood Prince</a>, after he hurts <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>. While there Ginny asked Harry to close his eyes while she goes and hides the Half-Blood Prince book so that he and other students can not find it, when she returned to him, Ginny kisses Harry. Harry was very much delighted and surprised that he received a kiss from her. It is implied that they are still dating at the end of the film.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">novel version of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a>, Harry and Ginny kiss on Harry's seventeenth birthday in Ginny's bedroom at <a href="/wiki/The_Burrow" title="The Burrow">the Burrow</a>, and Ron interrupts them when he opens the door.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">film version of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part One</a>, Harry was in the kitchen at the <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley family</a> home, on the day of the <a href="/wiki/Wedding_of_William_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour" title="Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour">wedding</a> of <a href="/wiki/William_Weasley" title="William Weasley">Bill Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fleur_Delacour" title="Fleur Delacour">Fleur Delacour</a>. Ginny arrives into the room, she asked him to fasten the zip of her bridesmaid dress. Harry and Ginny talked and shared a kiss, while they were kissing Ginny's brother <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a> comes into the room and interrupts them.</li></ul></li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i>, Ginny and Neville are both climbing up on one of the staircases, and run into Harry during the battle. Neville ask Harry if he has seen <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, then he confesses to Ginny and Harry that he as feelings for Luna, he went away to find and tell her. Harry and Ginny share a quick kiss, Harry was going to tell Ginny that he loved her, but Ginny quickly told him that she knows, and they both went back to what they were doing before they met up. This did not happen in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a></i> book.</li>
<li>A running gag in the books is the messiness of Harry's hair. In the films, this is not mentioned except for a reference in the fourth film. Harry notices that Hagrid has combed his hair so he will look good for <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Olympe Maxime</a>. When Harry says to him, <i>"Hagrid, have you combed your hair?!"</i> Hagrid states, <i>"As a matter of fact, I have. You might wanna try the same thing now and again".</i></li>
<li>Harry Potter is still the only wizard to this day that has had all three <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curses</a> cast on him and survived.
<ul><li>He also used two out of the three: the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a>. The only one he never used was the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a>, which on the contrary is his nemesis' favourite spell.</li></ul></li>
<li>Despite Remus Lupin suggested him not to let the <i><a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Expelliarmus</a></i> become his signature spell, this was the very spell which Harry used in his last duel against Voldemort.</li>
<li>The first spell casted on Harry, <i><a href="/wiki/Mending_Charm" title="Mending Charm">Reparo</a></i>, used by Hermione Granger on the Hogwarts Express during their first encounter, is also the last spell used by Harry in the novels.</li>
<li>Both <a href="/wiki/Michael_Corner" title="Michael Corner">Michael Corner</a> and Harry have dated the same girls, but in a different order, Cho Chang and Ginny Weasley.</li>
<li>Despite being a talented Quidditch player (and the team Seeker, considered the most important player on the team), Harry never played a full season (every minute of all three matches):
<ul><li>In his first year, he was recuperating in the hospital wing after saving the Philosopher's Stone, and thus missed the final match.</li>
<li>In his second year, the final match of the season was cancelled due to the attack on Hermione and <a href="/wiki/Penelope_Clearwater" title="Penelope Clearwater">Penelope Clearwater</a>.</li>
<li>In his third year, Harry came closest to playing a full season, but spent the last few seconds of the opening Gryffindor vs. Hufflepuff match unconscious after being attacked by Dementors.</li>
<li>In his fourth year, the Quidditch Cup was cancelled due to the Triwizard Tournament.</li>
<li>In his fifth year, Harry was banned by Dolores Umbridge after the opening Gryffindor vs. Slytherin match.</li>
<li>In his sixth year, Harry was knocked unconscious partway through the second match of the season against Hufflepuff, and then held in detention for the final match against Ravenclaw.</li>
<li>In what would have been his seventh year, he didn't attend Hogwarts due to his quest to destroy the Horcruxes.</li></ul></li></ul>

<ul><li>J.K. Rowling has said that because of the demands of his life, Harry has had less sexual experience than boys of his age might have had.<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">&#91;166&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>J.K. Rowling has said that Harry's glasses are a clue to his vulnerability.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>J.K. Rowling has said that the character of Wart from <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T._H._White" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:T. H. White">T. H. White</a>'s <i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sword_in_the_Stone" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:The Sword in the Stone">The Sword in the Stone</a></i> is "Harry's spiritual ancestor".<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Like his parents, Harry personally defied Voldemort three times before defeating him the fourth time: once in the Philosopher's Stone Chambers, once at the cemetery in Little Hangleton, and once again during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries. However, there were five previous encounters, if one counts the events of Harry's second year with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_Diary" class="mw-redirect" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s Diary">Tom Riddle's Diary</a>, though that was a memory instead of the real Voldemort, and the night his parents were killed in <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hollow" title="Godric&#39;s Hollow">Godric's Hollow</a>.</li>
<li>Harry learns a new mode of transportation in every book.
<ul><li>In his first year, he learns to travel by <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a>.</li>
<li>In his second year, he travels by <a href="/wiki/Floo_Powder" title="Floo Powder">Floo Powder</a> and <a href="/wiki/Flying_Ford_Anglia" title="Flying Ford Anglia">Flying Ford Anglia</a>.</li>
<li>In his third year, he travels on the <a href="/wiki/Knight_Bus" title="Knight Bus">Knight Bus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a> the <a href="/wiki/Hippogriff" title="Hippogriff">hippogriff</a> lets him take a ride on his back.</li>
<li>In his fourth year, he gets to the <a href="/wiki/Quidditch_World_Cup" title="Quidditch World Cup">Quidditch World Cup</a> by <a href="/wiki/Portkey" title="Portkey">portkey</a>.</li>
<li>In his fifth year, he travels to the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> by <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestral</a>.</li>
<li>In his sixth year, he learns to <a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">Apparate</a>.</li>
<li>In the seventh book, he breaks into <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts</a> and flies out on a <a href="/wiki/Dragon" title="Dragon">dragon</a>.</li></ul></li>
<li>The only autographs he ever gave out were to <a href="/wiki/Colin_Creevey" title="Colin Creevey">Colin Creevey</a> and an unknown man on the Hogwarts Express.</li>
<li>In <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2: Behind the Magic</i>, the person who makes all the wands for the films revealed that Dan has gone through over 80 wands over the course of the ten years because he drums with them.</li>
<li>A variant of Harry is available in the "Downloadable Character Pack" <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downloadable_content" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Downloadable content">DLC</a> for <i><a href="/wiki/LEGO_Harry_Potter:_Years_5-7" title="LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7">LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7</a></i>. The variant is called "Harry (Yule Ball)" because it portrays Harry wearing the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_dress_robes" title="Harry Potter&#39;s dress robes">dress robes</a> he wore to the <a href="/wiki/Yule_Ball" title="Yule Ball">Yule Ball</a>.</li>
<li>In the <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> film, Harry tells Dumbledore at the train station that he likes riding around on trains as it takes his mind off things.</li>
<li>Daniel Radcliffe said in an interview that Daphne seemed to have adopted him like another father. Interestingly, Daphne plays Daniel's (Harry's) daughter.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">&#91;169&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>Harry Potter is J. K. Rowling's favourite character, though she feels that she is unusual in this, as she finds that Ron is generally more popular.<sup class="noprint">&#91;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Wikipedia:Citing sources"><i><span title="The material in the vicinity of this tag needs references to reliable sources." style="white-space: nowrap;">citation needed</span></i></a>&#93;</sup></li>
<li>A rumour circulating on the Internet stated that early drafts of the second half of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i> included a scene in which Harry lost his virginity, but that this scene was cut to avoid complaints from parents. J. K. Rowling confirmed that this rumour was false, however,<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">&#91;170&#93;</a></sup> later further clarifying that she "never wrote it, never announced it, and never edited it out".<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">&#91;171&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>On his famous wizard card shown in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (video game)">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (video game)</a></i>, Harry's year of birth was not given, instead question marks were shown, indicating his year of birth may not have been made public in the wizarding world.</li>
<li>Just like his best friend Ron Weasley, Harry got a Muggle driving licence and bought himself a car, but it was never said if they got the Licence to Apparate (although, both of them having been Aurors, most likely they did).</li></ul>
<h3><span id="Author's_comments"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Author.27s_comments">Author's comments</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter?veaction=edit&amp;section=106" class="mw-editsection-visualeditor" title="Edit section: Author&#039;s comments">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-divider"> | </span><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter?action=edit&amp;section=106" title="Edit section: Author&#039;s comments"><svg class="wds-icon wds-icon-tiny section-edit-pencil-icon"><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-pencil-tiny"></use></svg>edit source</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul><li>"<i>The plan was, which I really hope I fulfilled, is that the reader, like Harry, would gradually discover Ginny as pretty much the ideal girl for Harry. She's tough, not in an unpleasant way, but she's gutsy. He needs to be with someone who can stand the demands of being with Harry Potter, because he's a scary boyfriend in a lot of ways. He's a marked man. I think she's funny, and I think that she's very warm and compassionate. These are all things that Harry requires in his ideal woman. But, I felt — and I'm talking years ago when all this was planned — initially, she's terrified by his image. I mean, he's a bit of a rock god to her when she sees him first, at 10 or 11, and he's this famous boy. So Ginny had to go through a journey as well… I feel that Ginny and Harry, in this book, they are total equals. They are worthy of each other. They've both gone through a big emotional journey, and they've really got over a lot of delusions, to use your word, together. So, I enjoyed writing that.</i>"<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">&#91;172&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>"<i>Harry and Ginny are real soul mates. They’re both very strong and very passionate. That’s their connection, and they’re remarkable together.</i>"</li>
<li>"<i>Ginny and Harry really are soulmates. I think she’s like Harry. She’s got an intellectual curiosity and she’s got something of belief.</i>"</li>
<li>"<i>Harry and Ginny were always meant to be together. I thought it was obvious, but apparently there were internet wars about this.</i>"</li>
<li>"<i>Harry's love for Ginny is true.</i>"</li>
<li>"<i>It was not an arbitrary decision: holly has certain connotations that were perfect for Harry, particularly when contrasted with the traditional associations of yew, from which <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_wand" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s wand">Voldemort’s wand</a> is made. European tradition has it that the holly tree (the name comes from ‘holy’) repels evil, while yew, which can achieve astonishing longevity (there are British yew trees over two thousand years old), can symbolise both death and resurrection; the sap is also poisonous. Some time after I had given Harry his holly-and-phoenix wand I came across a description of how the <a href="/wiki/Celts" title="Celts">Celts</a> had assigned trees to different parts of the year and discovered that, entirely by coincidence, I had assigned Harry the ‘correct’ wood for his <a href="/wiki/31_July" title="31 July">day of birth</a>.</i>"<sup id="cite_ref-JKR_173-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JKR-173">&#91;173&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
